== About ==

* Born 1970 in Germany, living in Berlin, Germany
* Speaking German, English, and Portuguese, some French
* Currently manager of <nowiki>[[http://www.openprinting.org/|OpenPrinting]]</nowiki> and contracted by Canonical to do printing stuff in Ubuntu
* Linux user since 1996, Linux admin since 1997, Linux developer since 2000

== Activities ==

* Everything to make printing in Linux "just work"
* Manager of the <nowiki>[[http://www.openprinting.org/|OpenPrinting]]</nowiki> project at the <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/|Linux Foundation]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://linux-foundation.org/weblogs/press/2006/07/18/the-free-standards-group-unites-linux-printing-initiatives/|Merged the former linuxprinting.org (I was the maintainer since 2001) with OpenPrinting]]</nowiki>
** Principal <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/OpenPrinting/Database/DatabaseIntro|printer compatibility database]]</nowiki> used by all distros
** Developing <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/OpenPrinting/Development|standard APIs]]</nowiki> for printing
** Working on the printing part of the <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/Developers|LSB]]</nowiki>.
** Developing the <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/OpenPrinting/WritingAndPackagingPrinterDrivers|LSB DDK for making distribution independent, auto-downloadable printer and scanner driver packages]]</nowiki>
** Developing <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/OpenPrinting/Database/Foomatic|Foomatic]]</nowiki>, the software behing the printer database and for integration of all printer drivers with all printing systems
** Organizing several <nowiki>[[https://www.linux-foundation.org/en/OpenPrinting/MeetingInfo|printing-related conferences]]</nowiki> throughout the year, especially the yearly <nowiki>[[http://www.openprinting.org/|OpenPrinting]]</nowiki> Summits
** Supporting the <nowiki>[[http://www.mmiworks.net/eng/publications/labels/openPrinting.html|Common Printing Dialog]]</nowiki>, a collaboration of <nowiki>[[http://www.openprinting.org/|OpenPrinting]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.openusability.org/|OpenUsability]]</nowiki>
** Organizing the participation of the Linux Foundation in the Google Summer of Code 2008, entered with 5 student projects for <nowiki>[[http://www.openprinting.org/|OpenPrinting]]</nowiki>
* Contracted by Canonical for work on the printing part of Ubuntu
** Packaging CUPS, CUPS-DDK, Ghostscript, Foomatic, system-config-printer, hal-cups-utils, HPLIP, Gutenprint, foo2zjs, SpliX, min12xx, m2300w, ...
** Packagiung of Ghostscript and HPLIP in collaboration with Debian
** Answering and triaging printing-related bug reports, fixing bugs, making upstream developers and printer manufacturers aware of problems
** Member of printing and QA teams
** MOTU
** Made Plug'n'Print (automatic print queue setup) working in Ubuntu Gutsy
** Replaced the unmaintained gnome-cups-manager by Red Hat's system-config-printer in Ubuntu Gutsy
** Sponsoring uploads of Brother driver packages to Multiverse (packaged by Sa√Øvann Carignan and Jeremy Schoenhaar)
* Upstream development activity
** Collaboration with Tim Waugh from Red Hat on upstream development of system-config-printer and hal-cups-utils
** <nowiki>[[http://www.cups.org/espgs/index.php|Merger of ESP Ghostscript with GPL Ghostscript]]</nowiki>
** VCS write access for Gutenprint, ESP Ghostscript (project discontinued), GPL Ghostscript, system-config-printer, hal-cups-utils
** Beta tester for <nowiki>[[http://hplip.sf.net|HPLIP]]</nowiki> (HP Linux Printing and Imaging)
** Contacts with driver developers at most major printer manufacturers: HP, Ricoh, Epson, Canon, Kyocera, Konica Minolta, Samsung, Fuji Xerox, ...
* Former activities
** Responsible for printing and digital imaging for the Mandriva distribution from mid 2000 to mid 2006
** Given various talks and tutorials about printing and digital photography with Linux on several conferences
** Organized booths about printing with Linux on the <nowiki>[[http://www.linuxtag.org|LinuxTag]]</nowiki> 2001-2006
